alert.note: Alert for Custer; Northern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:28PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Custer and northern Rosebud Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 526 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles southwest of Miles City, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain producing localized flooding. Also winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Angela, Hathaway and Moon Creek Ranch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
